assessments.task_description:
You will be required to complete two consecutive interpreting tasks: interpreting one monologue from English into Chinese/Japanese in the consecutive mode and then interpreting a LOTE monologue from Chinese/Japanese into English in the consecutive mode. Both monologues are approximately 700 words long, of medium complexity, and given in business settings. Students will be given the speech topics and interpreting brief one week in advance. On the day of the exam, there won't be any preparation time for each interpreting activity. Students' interpreting performance in the exam will be assessed according to the marking rubric of this course.

Statement on Generative AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment task is designed to be face-to-face in a designated lab. Students' interpreting performances are recorded by the lecturer using voice-recorders in the designated lab for this course. Students can use their own voice-recorders to record their interpreting performances as a backup in case there is a technical problem.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
